<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Folklorist Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3034) <actions string="" />
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Strength of Thousands</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #170: Spoken on the Song Wind](/Sources.aspx?ID=97) pg. 78</row>

**Archetype** [Folklorist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=105)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=12)

</column>

---

You are a master archivist and entertainer, capable of pulling wisdom from the tales you tell and weaving your allies and enemies into a powerful narrative. You gain the Spin Tale action. 

**Spin Tale** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([auditory](/Traits.aspx?ID=16), [linguistic](/Traits.aspx?ID=101)) **Frequency** once every 10 minutes; **Effect** You tell a story, designating one of your allies (but not yourself) as the hero of the story, and one enemy as the villain; both must be within 60 feet. The hero gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saving throws against the villain until the start of your next turn. If you Spin a Tale on your next turn, the story continues for another round, for a maximum of 10 rounds. While the tale continues, minor, crude illusions spring into being in your space; these are [arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11) [illusion](/Traits.aspx?ID=92) effects that have no mechanical impact other than illustrating your tale.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you've gained two other feats from the folklorist archetype.

<title level="2">Folklorist Dedication leads to...</title>
[Communal Tale](/Feats.aspx?ID=3038), [Folktales Lore](/Feats.aspx?ID=3035), [Narrative Conduit](/Feats.aspx?ID=3036), [Rule of Three](/Feats.aspx?ID=3037)
